bill_title: permit the Department of Transportation to require reflective tape on railroad cars.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to permit the Department of Transportation to require reflective tape on railroad cars. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 49-16A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If the Department of Transportation determines it is necessary for the safety and protection of the public, the department shall order a railroad to place reflective tape on railroad cars operating in South Dakota in a manner and method suitable for the protection of the public. The department shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish procedures, requirements, and criteria for taping railroad cars pursuant to this Act. The Department of Corrections shall make inmate labor available to the railroad to assist in the placement of reflective tape pursuant to this Act. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
